title.narrative: Emprender Paz- private sector and peace award
Emprender Paz- private sector and peace award

description.narrative:
CORPORACION EMPRENDER PAZ has applied to Sida for funding of 3 million SEK to carry out the project “EMPRENDER PAZ AWARD” for the period 1 July 2016 - 31 June 2019
The project aims at promoting the positive contribution that the private sector can bring in generation of sustainable economic opportunities for the population affected by the armed conflict and thereby supporting peace building. Through raising awareness activities directed to private companies, increased visibility of positive experiences and the possibility to strengthen the initiatives, it is aimed at incentive more companies to be committed to and actively participating in the development of peace-building initiatives as part of their core business. The prize is awarded annually to four private sector initiatives that are chosen based on predetermined criteria and a rigorous selection process. The project total budget is 5,5 million SEK, of which Sweden will contribute with the 54%.

Corporación Emprender Paz har ansökt om finansiering till Sida om 3 miljoner SEK för att genomföra insats ”Emprender Paz Award” under perioden 1 st juli 2016 – 31 june 2019. Insatsen förväntas främja att den privata sektorn bidrar positivt till möjligheter inom hållbar ekonomisk utveckling för den av konflikten utsatta befolkningen och därmed bidra till hållbart fredsbyggande. Genom att genomföra påverkansarbete med privata företag, ökad synlighet och förstärkning av goda erfarenheter, har insatsen som målsättning att skapa incitament för fler företag att engagera sig och aktivt delta i utvecklingen av fredsbyggande initiativ som del av företagens kärnverksamhet. Ett pris delas ut årligen till fyra initiativ från privata sektorn och välj utifrån förbestämda kriterier och en rigorös utvalsprocess.

title.narrative: Grant agreement 55190020- Emprender Paz private sector and peace award
Decision on contribution 55190020-Private sector and peace award
Decision on major amendment-55190020- Emprender Paz private sector and peace award

description.narrative: On the 17th of October 2019, an amendment to the agreement was signed between the Embassy of Sweden and Corporación Emprender Paz (CEP), extending the agreement period until December 2021 and adding a further 3 million Swedish Krona to the project. The last narrative report covered the period until June 2019; however, the amendment included a new reporting period from January to December, in alignment with the other donors’ reporting period and includes financial and audit reports up to December 2019. The narrative, financial and audit reports cover the period from July 2018 to December 2019. However, as the amendment to the agreement analysed the results up to June 2019, this conclusion on performance will only update results for the last 6 months of 2019 and include conclusion of financial and audit reports for the whole reporting period from the 1st of July 2018 to the 31st of December 2019. In September 2019, four newly awarded companies joined the already identified group of companies with best practices and initiatives in peace building. The award ceremony held on the 10th of September 2019, with more than 195 participants, recognized: Agricapital; Asociación de Productores de Café de Alta Calidad “Cuchilla de San Juan”; Mundo Maderas; and Palmiagro del Norte S.A.S, as companies with the best peace building initiatives in 2019, from a total of 124 nominees and 10 finalists. These companies have invested a total of COP $2, 978 million equivalents to approximately one million US Dollars in the recognised initiatives, thereby showing their commitment and ownership. The invitation for proposals for 2019, held between the 1st of March to the 30th of May, 2019, received a response from 124 companies representing different sectors (agriculture 38%; agribusiness 27%; services 24%; industry 7%; extractive industry 3% ) and various sizes (micro 70%; small 14%; medium 2%;and big 14%), that together benefit more than 42,000 people (18,856 women and 23,459 men) from 28 Departments affected by the conflict. The number of participants has risen from 54 in 2018 to 124 in 2019. In addition to media recognition, during 2019, the four winners from 2018 (Corpocampo, Chocolate Colombia, Securitas and Takami) also received technical assistance to help improve their initiatives. The first three winners from 2018, satisfactorily finished their consultancy projects in June 2019 and the consultancy for ASOPESAN-Takami was ultimately developed directly by Takami between October and December 2019 as explained below: Takami owns a group of restaurants in Bogota and since 2016 has been looking for fish suppliers who use responsible fishing practices and standards. They started buying directly from ASOPESAN, an association of 35 fishermen that returned to their land in Litoral de San Juan-Chocó after a forced displacement. Takami provided technical support to ASOPESAN to help achieve the required practices and standards and paid more stable and higher prices than the local market. The commercial relationship has allowed ASOPESAN to achieve better incomes. However, as they needed to strengthen their internal processes to be able to respond to the orders from Takami regularly and efficiently, the technical assistance focused on that aspect. Corporación Emprender Paz (CEP) hired the consultancy services from a local supplier that unfortunately did not comply with the contract. After many discussions between Takami and the association (ASOPESAN), they found that the better solution was for Takami to directly implement the technical assistance itself. CEP and the Embassy saw this as a demonstration of the company’s commitment to the local fisherman’s association (ASOPESAN). From October to December 2019, Takami helped ASOPESAN to comply with the pending legal requirements with the Chamber of Commerce and the Colombian National Taxes and Customs Directorate (DIAN is its acronym in Spanish). Takami also trained the members of the association on document management, product costing, responsibilities on being part of an association, content and use of financial reports, teamwork and division of roles and responsibilities, communication and trust. Finally, they organized new weekly and biweekly tours to buy fresh fish from neighbouring communities in Pichima, Togoroma and Otenedo. The impact analysis of the technical assistance given to the four winners from 2018 was initially planned for November and December 2019. However, CEP changed Executive Director at that moment and therefore this activity was postponed until the first half of 2020 but, unfortunately, this had to be further postponed due to the Covid-19 global pandemic and the subsequent lockdown measures. CEP will monitor these results during 2020 and the analysis will appear in the next reporting period. Likewise, as part of the award, the four above-mentioned 2019 winners will receive technical assistance in 2020. After agreement between CEP and the winners, the procurement process to obtain the necessary technical assistance was developed between December 2019 and February 2020. However, due to the Covid 19 crisis and the subsequent lockdown measures introduced by the Colombian government, the consultancy contracts have not been formalized and are currently postponed until the second half of 2020. The four winners for 2019 and who will receive the proposed technical assistance are: Agricapital: a small financial institution that provides financial solutions to small peasant farmer producers with low interest rates and close technical support about the business model and financial management. The collateral used by Agricapital for loans is the contract with an anchor company that will buy their production, so the buyer contributes to loan repayments. This innovative solution has already benefited more than 800 small peasant farmer producers that didn’t have access to financial services and are not serviced by the traditional banks. The technical assistance that is planned to be provided by CEP will develop a technological tool for loans information management. The coffee producer Association from Cuchilla de San Juan is a small agriculture association that brings together 123 coffee growers and their families that, through an agroindustry centre, buy the green coffee and process it under high environmental standards. The association requested accompaniment and technical support to comply with fair trade certification to be able to continue exporting to Canadian clients. Mundo Maderas is a small company that produces and repairs wooden pallets. The company, that started in 2009 as part of an international cooperation program, provides job opportunities to 90 ex-combatants from illegal armed groups that were part of individual or collective reintegration and peace processes. The company is allied to the National Reintegration Agency (ARN). The required consultancy aims at optimizing production processes to reduce operational costs and improve sustainability and competitiveness of the business model. Finally, Palmiagro del Norte S.A.S is a medium sized agro-industrial association that brings together 300 small palm-oil producers in Tibu-Norte de Santander. This association, that started in 2013 as part of an illicit crops substitution program, integrates 5 associations of small palm-oil farmers who took the initiative for business consolidation, provision of technical, social, administrative and financial assistance services, an agricultural warehouse, a nursery, and the marketing of oil palm fruit with environmental standards for soil and water protection. The technical assistance requested from CEP is to train the 300 members in good governance and on being part of an association to strengthen their collective process. As a lesson learned from the previous year, during the first half of 2019, Corporación Emprender Paz (CEP) implemented the communication strategy, improving advertising for inviting proposals. The awarded initiatives and the invitation for proposals were publicised in 38 reports: 16 in the printed press, 20 in the digital press, 11 on the radio and 4 on TV. This coverage was higher than the previous year and was a positive result of the communication strategy implemented. In addition, the Corporation promoted the invitiation for proposals for the 2019 award in private meetings with national editors, as well as at two national events (Macrorueda Reconciliación and Market Place- Andi Foundation). During the second half of 2019 CEP procured a new communication strategy contract with the agency ACERCA with the aim of increasing visibility of the 2019 finalists and winners. A total of 49 reports were registered (4 on Television, 10 on radio, 10 in the printed press and 25 online) which was also higher than in 2018. Finally, as a lesson learned from the previous year, the Corporation developed a raising awareness strategy for the private sector, inviting companies through the Chambers of Commerce of Bogota, Dos Quebradas, Medellín and Ibagué for regional forums with the participation of winners from previous years. These examples showed that it is possible to contribute to peace building while maintaining a sustainable business or even, in some cases, peace building initiatives, linked with their value chain, have also brought economic dividends for the companies. The financial report is presented according to what is stipulated in the agreement, including the received amount in COP, the accrued interest and the executed funds compared with the approved budget. The Embassy’s assessment is that CEP has shown good results in the previous phase as well as good financial management. The financial execution was done in accordance with the approved budget. The audit does not include any material findings. According to the Auditor’s report, CEP has implemented and used the resources according to Sida´s management rules without any deviations. The report confirmed an existing and suitable internal control system that is known and applied by appropriate staff. The report also confirmed that CEP has an accounting system that is in accordance with Colombian regulations and rules. The tax records and payments are also done in accordance with Colombian legislation. The Embassy’s assessment is that the financial and audit reports are presented in accordance with Sida´s requirement in the agreement and therefore was approved. The statement of financial, audit and updated narrative report was registered, the reports approved and agreement conditions updated in Planit.
